text:

text: The Trump administration is refusing to accept new applications while it undertakes a "comprehensive review" of DACA â€”  despite a ruling from the Supreme Court that  blocked President Trumpâ€™s effort to end the program last month. https://t.co/g1jTunjmt8

name: NPR
text:
Almost 300,000 nursing home residents are given antipsychotic drugs each weekâ€”despite most having no psychosis to justify it.

And under the Trump administration, nursing homes have rarely paid a price for even the most serious misuses, a new report finds.

name: NPR
text:
With much of the Navajo Nation stuck at home due to the pandemic, one Navajo farmer is on a mission to help people return to their roots by teaching traditional farming techniques.
https://t.co/oLJvolOtYC

name: NPR
text: The Remington Arms Company, which has been making guns in the U.S. since 1816, filed for bankruptcy protection amid ongoing legal and financial challenges. https://t.co/QLV1tFd0LJ

name: NPR
text:
We've come to expect legal waivers for things like skiing or bungee-jumping.

But now colleges and businesses â€” from hair salons to dentists' offices â€” are using them to try to shield themselves from liability as they reopen during the pandemic.
https://t.co/ACAMOVGaoX

name: NPR
text: An Australian pub has banned two emus, siblings Kevin and Carol, after they learned to climb the pub steps and created havoc inside â€” stealing food from customers and loitering behind the bar. https://t.co/wWZhykx7PP

name: NPR
text: Republicans are signaling that the Census Bureau cannot take the extra time it needs to deliver the 2020 census amid the coronavirus pandemic â€” even if that risks severe inaccuracies in the once-a-decade count. https://t.co/82j0Kjv8Ua

text: The nation's second-largest teachers union says it will support its 1.7 million members going on strike if health precautions are not met amid calls for schools to reopen in the fall. https://t.co/ngz1mhlTVN

text:

name: NPR
text:

name: NPR
text:

Some worry the program is overpromising.

name: NPR
text:
Red Lobster staff in Ohio were unpacking a delivery of live crustaceans when they noticed something strange: a rare American blue lobster. Just 1 in 2 million are blue, researchers believe.

It was spared â€” and now lives at the Akron Zoo.
https://t.co/oWmJlYkMc0

name: NPR
text: The use of technologies that help some workers do their work remotely could have unanticipated, long-lasting effects on other workers with lower-paid jobs. https://t.co/GZ9GMCd9o6

name: NPR
text:

â€œI've lived with the survivor's guilt of that moment ever since," she says. https://t.co/hATmd5VWxc

name: NPR
text:
The power of moms as activists is being proven again by the Wall of Moms protesting in Portland.

Stereotypes about gender, as well as race, have long played a role in shaping that power â€” as well as who gets to wield it. https://t.co/IcM21QhtXm

text:
